data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word الْهُدَى comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.

data.meanings: to turn the back, flee, follow after, be behind, become old, take a thing away, veer to the west wind, elapse (day, night), follow with respect.Back, hinder part, the last, extremity, that which comes after, at the end of, extreme, last remnant, uttermost part.To dispose, manage, govern, consider, the issues or results of the affairs or the case, perform or execute the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair, regulate.Consequence, result.idbar = retreat, withdrawal, setting.
data.sentence: The word أَدْبَارِهِمْ comes from the root د ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to turn the back, flee, follow after, be behind, become old, take a thing away, veer to the west wind, elapse (day, night), follow with respect.Back, hinder part, the last, extremity, that which comes after, at the end of, extreme, last remnant, uttermost part.To dispose, manage, govern, consider, the issues or results of the affairs or the case, perform or execute the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair with thought or consideration, devise or plan the affair, regulate.Consequence, result.idbar = retreat, withdrawal, setting.

data.meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.
data.sentence: The word ارْتَدُّوا comes from the root ر د د and is associated with the meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.

data.sentence: The word سَوَّلَ comes from the root س و ل and is associated with the meanings: to delude, entice, contrive, suggest, prepare, embellish, deceive, lead one to error.

data.meanings: To live long, enjoy a thing.
data.sentence: The word وَأَمْلَى comes from the root م ل و and is associated with the meanings: To live long, enjoy a thing.
